FuncDef:
The dns-search-list command sets a domain name suffix.
The undo dns-search-list command cancels a domain name suffix.
By default, a domain name suffix is not configured.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the domain name suffix.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-insensitive characters.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
For example, when you enter "yahoo" in the address bar of the Internet Explorer, a domain name suffix, for example "com.cn", is added automatically. This facilitates domain name resolution.
You can set only one domain name suffix for an IPv6 address pool.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
